description_txt: stated on March 16, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "About 22 percent of adults in Rhode Island and approximately 30 percent of youth (ages 10-17) are considered obese."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • March 25, 2011

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2011 in televised interviews:
quote_txt: On whether the United States should intervene in Libya.

description_txt: stated on March 22, 2011 in MSNBC's "Last Word":
quote_txt: "Most Americans live within 50 miles of a nuclear power plant."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2011 in a letter to IRS Commissioner Douglas Shulman:
quote_txt: "The entire state of Florida led the nation last year with the most prison inmates committing tax fraud."

description_txt: stated on March 3, 2011 in a statement at a news conference:
quote_txt: Wisconsin was embroiled in a "constitutional crisis" brought on by the Democratic senators fleeing the state for Illinois to block Gov. Scott Walker's budget-repair bill.

description_txt: stated on March 3, 2011 in a House committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Due to a flaw in the 1995 Outer Continental Shelf Deep Water Royalty Relief Act numerous oil companies are now drilling in the Gulf of Mexico in federal lands and paying no royalties to the federal government."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2007 in an interview with the "Boston Globe":
quote_txt: On the president unilaterally authorizing a military attack "that does not involve stopping an actual or imminent threat to the nation."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2011 in comments on his Fox News show.:
quote_txt: Says Allen West helped thwart a terrorist plot by shooting a gun in the direction of an Iraqi detainee, then reported the incident to his superior and said it was wrong.

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2011 in a House floor speech:
quote_txt: The U.S. gives foreign aid to Cuba and Venezuela, even though those countries are our enemies.

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in his State of the State speech:
quote_txt: Ohio Director of Job Creation "Mark Kvamme just clawed back about $900,000 from companies that made promises and they didn't keep them."

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: "Since President Obama took office, gas prices have gone up 67 percent."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Since 1980, over 145 incidents have been documented of suction entrapment in swimming pools and spas, including 36 deaths of children."

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2011 in an e-mail newsletter and House floor speech.:
quote_txt: "Not even expensive bottled water, like Perrier and Evian, are of good enough quality to pump out of mines in Southwest Virginia, according to the EPA regulation."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2011 in Fox's "O'Reilly Factor":
quote_txt: "There is a growing body of evidence that radiation in excess of what the government says are the minimum amounts you should be exposed to are actually good for you and reduce cases of cancer."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2011 in comments before a Senate committee.:
quote_txt: Says taxpayer resources are being used "to facilitate private political agendas" through automatic payroll deduction of union dues.

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: The coalition of Arab states against Libya’s Moammar Gadhafi is the biggest coalition against a fellow Arab leader since the Persian Gulf War in 1990-1991.

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2011 in a comment to reporters.:
quote_txt: Says the state’s budget shortfall is "not that much different" than it was in 2003.

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: "Eleven years ago, the city of Detroit lifted the residency requirement for police officers and today, 53 percent of officers live outside of the city. If we want the tax base of Milwaukee to resemble the tax base of Detroit, this is the way to go."

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2011 in an article published in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution:
quote_txt: Studies have shown that in the absence of federal reproductive health funds, we are going to see the level of abortion in Georgia increase by about 44 percent.

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2011 in a private briefing to Members of Congress:
quote_txt: "The Congressional Budget Office has this economic model where they measure the economy going forward, and they are now telling us that the entire economy crashes in the year 2037 because their computer simulation can't conceive of any way in which the U.S. economy can continue."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2011 in his weekly radio address.:
quote_txt: "According to 2009 estimates, an agreement with Panama could result in almost 1,900 Florida jobs in the first year – and about 15,000 jobs after five years."

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2011 in a comment to reporters.:
quote_txt: Says a "rather extraordinary amount of non-classroom employees" were added by Texas school districts over the last decade.

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a statement to a TV reporter:
quote_txt: Senate Democrats who left the state for weeks to delay a vote on union bargaining power exercised a "Wisconsin filibuster" provided by the state’s constitution.

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2011 in a Tweet.:
quote_txt: The GOP budget plan "would cut nearly a million jobs."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: "If you look at the jobs lost in the private sector as opposed to the job gains in the public sector, it's out of whack. The government's growing and the private economy's shrinking."

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2011 in a legislative hearing:
quote_txt: Says Oregon is "near the top or at the top of the list" when it comes to capital gains tax

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "What we have now is the most generous, in my opinion, 'good time' bill in the entire United States."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2011 in a statement at a candidate forum:
quote_txt: The state of Wisconsin pays plumbers, engineers and other attorneys "much, much more" than it pays attorneys to represent poor people.

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in newspaper interview:
quote_txt: "When I took office in 2003, we had very little reserves."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2011 in a video online:
quote_txt: Says "for the equivalent cost of a single mile of freeway, we have a bike infrastructure."
